intro: Hieracium altefurcatum, commonly known as the tall forked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, often with a prominent central disk. Hieracium altefurcatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
